title: How to Make Alcohol Free Sangria

steps.headline: Peel two of the oranges and cut the segments into little cubes or discs.
Cut four oranges in half and squeeze the juice out with a citrus presser.
steps.description: Alternatively, roll the uncut oranges on a board or work surface, cut them in half and use a fork to help you squeeze them.

steps.headline: Mix in a bowl or jug the squeezed orange juice, grape juice and cinnamon.
Open the can with peaches and cut them into small chunks.
Add the fruit and juice to the sangria mix.
Add the tinned mandarins and their juice.
Peel the two apples and cut them into small chunks.
steps.description: Add these to the juice immediately or they will discolor.

steps.headline: Peel the banana and cut it in to discs.
Add the juice of one lemon.
When the sangria is made, put it in the fridge to cool.

text: Peel two of the oranges and cut the segments into little cubes or discs.  Cut four oranges in half and squeeze the juice out with a citrus presser. Alternatively, roll the uncut oranges on a board or work surface, cut them in half and use a fork to help you squeeze them. Mix in a bowl or jug the squeezed orange juice, grape juice and cinnamon.  Open the can with peaches and cut them into small chunks.  Add the fruit and juice to the sangria mix.  Add the tinned mandarins and their juice.  Peel the two apples and cut them into small chunks. Add these to the juice immediately or they will discolor. Peel the banana and cut it in to discs.  Add the juice of one lemon.  When the sangria is made, put it in the fridge to cool.  Finished.
